Deficiency Narrative: One of three employee files reviewed did not contain verification the employee had a refresher EBI training in about 9 months.
Correction Narrative: A phone call was held with the operation's owner which indicated all youth have been discharged from the operation. On Oct. 7, 2024, the owner confirmed that the operation will be ceasing operations on a voluntary suspension basis until a new location can be found.

Deficiency Narrative: One out of three youth files reviewed did not contain a debriefing following a youth's return from unauthorized absences.
Correction Narrative: A phone call was held with the operation's owner which indicated all youth have been discharged from the operation. On Oct. 7, 2024, the owner confirmed that the operation will be ceasing operations on a voluntary suspension basis until a new location can be found.

Deficiency Narrative: During the walkthrough at the operation, it was observed the medication lock box was not double locked and access was available to youth in care.

During the investigation, it was discovered a child with sexual aggression history was placed with a roommate who had sexual victimization history, violating the aggressor child's service plan.  The facility is no longer in operation, mitigating risk in this standard.
A caregiver was photographed smoking while transporting youth in care in a vehicle.
Correction Narrative: Corrected.

Deficiency Narrative: During the course of the investigation, it was discerned staff transported a child in a vehicle with a handgun present as well as another staff reportedly storing a handgun in their vehicle on site.

During the investigation, it was discerned the owner of the operation questioned children following investigation issues, promised them bribes to present well, instructed staff to alter or omit documentation to prevent or reduce investigations, and failed to respond appropriately to allegations by staff and children.  The facility is no longer in operation, mitigating risk in this standard.

During the inspection, it was discovered staff and children expressed concern that an employee transported children and served as a caregiver while under the influence of alcohol and administration failed to respond in a timely and appropriate manner.  The facility is no longer in operation, mitigating risk in this standard.

During the inspection, it was determined a staff member had inappropriate sexual relations with children in care; staff was neglectful in supervision resulting in a child gaining access to, and being arrested for the possession of, staff's firearm; and staff being neglectful in supervision by leaving children in care alone and unsupervised at the facility while providing a child keys which access medications, supplies, and other prohibited areas.  The facility is no longer in operation, mitigating risk in this standard.
The operation was not in ratio during awake hours.
Correction Narrative: A phone call was held with the operation's owner who stated no youth are currently placed at the operation. Voluntary closure or suspension of the operation is pending.

Deficiency Narrative: One out of two employee files reviewed did not contain documentation to show employment history was verified.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the operation which included an employment history check form for verification for the employee who did not have one previously.

Deficiency Narrative: The administration/owner did not use prudent judgment when requiring the child to get back to the operation and not offering to get the child a ride back to the operation when the child made him aware that he could not get a ride.
Correction Narrative: Corrected.

Deficiency Narrative: Children in care were assisting staff and intervening with another child in care having a manic episode.
Correction Narrative: Corrected.

Deficiency Narrative: Three out of three employee files reviewed did not contain reference checks.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the operation's owner that included a corrective action plan indicating a reference check template was created to be utilized in the future to ensure reference checks are documented. A copy of the template was also included in the email.

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection, the operation was observed to not be clean evidenced by a urine smell in two of the bedrooms and old food on the floor behind the stove.
Four out of four first aid kits observed during the inspection was missing adhesive tape, thermometers, tweezers, and disposable gloves.
One out of three youth files reviewed had a dental appointment dated longer than the required maintenance of 6 months.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the operation's owner that included a corrective action plan indicating the dental visit verification has been added to the youth's file. The electronic file was reviewed in ExtendedReach and verified to have been updated.

Deficiency Narrative: A cleaning product was observed during the inspection accessible to youth in care under an unlocked bathroom sink.
The serious incident reports reviewed did not detail interventions made following the incidents.
Correction Narrative: During exit interview of inspection, the operation's owner stated the staff that wrote the two incident reports was terminated due to reasons such as not adhering to directives like accurately writing incident reports. He also stated he has conducted conferences with staff about documenting accurately and effectively for future occurrences.

Deficiency Narrative: Two medications reviewed for one youth in care was documented with the wrong ending count.
Correction Narrative: Corrected

Deficiency Narrative: One of three youth files reviewed did not include an immunization record or reasoning explaining for the lack of it.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the operation's owner that included a corrective action plan indicating the youth's file has been updated. The electronic file was reviewed in ExtendedReach and verified to have been updated.

Deficiency Narrative: The operation has been without an administrator for more than 120 days.
Correction Narrative: During a monitoring inspection #3982603, the operation's owner indicated he has hired an administrator and their background check has come back as eligible. This was verified in CLASS.

Deficiency Narrative: Operation staff laid on top of a child in care to gain control during a restraint.
Correction Narrative: Corrected.

Deficiency Narrative: The operation has not had an administrator for more than 90 days.
Two out of three employee files reviewed only contained verification for 8 hours completed for EBI training instead of the required 16 hours.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the operation's owner, Brandel Brown, which included the training certificates for the other half of the pre-service EBI training taken by the two employees who were missing it in their files originally.

Deficiency Narrative: Records requested from the operation on 11/21/2023 were not received until 12/20/2023.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the operation's owner which included a corrective action plan that indicates the operation recently hired an Administrator whose duty will be to provide requested documentation.

Deficiency Narrative: Service Plan completed for a child in care on 08/12/2023 indicates that the child should not be placed in a bedroom with any other children. This child was instead placed in a room with two roommates.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the operation's owner which included a corrective action plan that indicates the operation corrected the original service plan and has implemented it.

Deficiency Narrative: Operation provided an inaccurate copy of a child's service plan.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the operation's owner which included a corrective action plan that indicates the operation's Treatment Director and Administrator will be responsible for auditing every service plan for accuracy before it is finalized.

Deficiency Narrative: During walk through, it was observed that substance controll medication was not double lock.
During walk through, it was observed that the childrens bathroom was unequipt with handsoap and tissue.
The operation has not had an administrator for more than 60 days.
The staff list provided still included 4 previous employees.
Correction Narrative: The staff list provided still included 4 previous employees. this was corrected.

Deficiency Narrative: An attempt was made by CCI to do an on-site inspection and no one was there.
Correction Narrative: An attempt was made by CCI to do an on-site inspection and no one was there. this was corrected

Deficiency Narrative: Records were  requested at the start of the inspection licensing did not have access by the conclusion of the inspection.
Correction Narrative: Records were  requested at the start of the inspection licensing did not have access by the conclusion of the inspection. this was corrected.

Deficiency Narrative: It was observed that there were two originally packaged packs of fish in the sink in water thawing. The staff removed the packages of fish and begin to prepare dinner.

2 same medications log for the month of September 2023 for 1 child med log was reviewed. One of the med logs stated that Fluticasone Propio 50 MG was administered for the 1st of September 2023 at 7:15am and initialed by one staff while the second medication log for the month of September 2023 for same child stated that same medication was administered on the 1st of September at 7am and initialed by another staff.
Correction Narrative:
The operation stated in its written correction provided via email on 4-15-24 that they are currently using an electronic portal system (Extended Reach) that accurately stores and saves the records.

A follow up inspection (#3999432) was completed on 4-29-24 in which medications and their corresponding medication logs were reviewed for compliance and found to be compliant.

Deficiency Narrative: CCI Investigator requested for medication logs for all children for 2023 but the operation was not able to provide the records upon request.
Correction Narrative:
The operation stated in its written correction provided via email on 4-15-24 that they are currently using an electronic portal system (Extended Reach) that accurately stores and saves the records.

A follow up inspection (#3999432) was completed on 4-29-24 in which medications and their corresponding medication logs were reviewed for compliance and found to be compliant.

Deficiency Narrative: The unauthorized absence incident is documented to have occurred on 9/12/23 at 3:45pm, but the children's parent was not notified until 9/13/23 at 8:37pm.
Correction Narrative:
The unauthorized absence incident is documented to have occurred on 9/12/23 at 3:45pm, but the children's parent was not notified until 9/13/23 at 8:37pm.
This has been corrected.

Deficiency Narrative: One out of three employee files reviewed did not include a signed and notarized Affidavit for Employment.
Correction Narrative: A corrective action plan was received via email from the operation indicating the missing document had been uploaded to their external database. This was verified. The corrective action plan also indicated the operation will not move forward in the hiring process with a candidate if all required documents are not received timely.

Deficiency Narrative: Three out of three youth files reviewed were missing several documents in the files that the operation provided separately.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the operation that included a corrective action plan that indicated the missing documents had been uploaded to their external database. This was verified. The corrective action plan also indicated the operation will ensure documents are uploaded to the database within 48 hours after appointments or 7 days after a placement. This will be ensured by the compliance team.

Deficiency Narrative: A staff member admitted to calling a child in care a "crackhead".
Correction Narrative: A corrective action plan was submitted via email on August 28, 2023 that indicated the employee involved was taken off the schedule and had to undergo retraining of the Minimum Standards. It also indicated the employee had a conference to be reminded of children's rights and effective communication with the children in care. The corrective action plan indicates new hires will also get the same extensive training to ensure this doesn't occur again, and it will be ensured by the owner. On August 29, 2023, a couple of youth were interviewed at their school and denied any inappropriate discipline still occurring at the operation. The interviews are in Chronology.

Deficiency Narrative: The operation's Treatment Director's personnel file was not provided as requested.
Correction Narrative: A phone call was received from the operation's owner indicating that the Treatment Director no longer is employed by the operation and he will be removed from their employee list in the provider portal.

Deficiency Narrative: Twelve fire drills conducted by the operation were indicated to have lasted significantly longer than three minutes.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the operation's owner that included a copy of the evacuation drills conducted thus far this year. The new drills met the time requirement.

Deficiency Narrative: Two out of two serious incident reports reviewed did not include the interventions made by staff or the resolution to the incident.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the operation's owner which included the updated incident reports to include the missing information.

Deficiency Narrative: One out of two employee records reviewed indicated the TB skin test was completed more than 30 days after hire.
Correction Narrative: A corrective action plan was received via email from the operation's owner indicating the administrator will be responsible for ensuring TB skin tests are scheduled for employees during their orientation week to ensure they are completed timely.

Deficiency Narrative: One out of two employee files reviewed did not contain a signed affidavit for employment, indication of date of hire, or verification of completed TB skin test.
Correction Narrative: A phone call was received from the operation's owner stating the employee had provided false documentation for the missing items originally; therefore, disciplinary action will occur for the employee and true documentation will be attained and provided.

Deficiency Narrative: Two out of two first aid kits did not contain a guide, tweezers, gloves, scissors, tape, or gauze pads. One out of two first aid kits did not contain a thermometer.
Correction Narrative: Corrected.

Deficiency Narrative: Cleaning supplies were observed to be stored in two accessible areas for youth in care.
Staff members were observed not being in the proper caregiver/child ratio. Two staff were interviewed and confirmed they were out of ratio for a short period of time.
Correction Narrative: Corrected.

Deficiency Narrative: Not all requested child documents were provided or provided within the specified timeframe.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the operation's owner, Brandel Brown, including a corrective action plan that indicated all requested documents will be provided by the operation's case manager within 24 hours moving forward. Completion of this will be ensured by the administrator per the CAP.

Deficiency Narrative: There is not always administrative staff present at the operation during normal business hours to assist with administrative duties such as allowing Licensing to conduct an inspection.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the operation which included a corrective action plan indicating the administrator will be responsible for hiring a case manager to be present at the operation during normal business hours.

Deficiency Narrative: A medication label was said to have had the wrong quantity printed compared to the medication log reviewed, but the operation failed to get the label corrected.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the operation which included a corrective action plan indicating the administrator will be responsible for contacting the pharmacy within 24 hours after discovering a medication label error.

Deficiency Narrative: All active records were not in the files reviewed timely.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the operation which included a corrective action plan indicating the administrator will be responsible for ensuring all documentation is compiled within 14 days of placement. The plan also indicated the caseworker will be contacted about missing documentation within three days after placement to ensure the documentation is received timely.

Deficiency Narrative: Two discharged youth's medications were stored in the same box with current youth's medications.
The unauthorized absence log was not available upon request.
Correction Narrative: A phone conversation was held with the operation's owner, Brandel Brown. Mr. Brown requested for an extension to provide the AWOL log since an employee initially stated they accidently took it home but recanted recently. He stated he would have to create a new log by reviewing through all of the past incident reports. A week extension has been granted (January 17, 2023). On January 17, 2023, an email was received from the operation's owner, Brandel Brown, which included the Unauthorized Absence Log for the operation from the entire year of 2022.

Deficiency Narrative: The serious incident report did not have the names of the children involved in the incident.
Correction Narrative:
A phone call was received on Monday, Feb 13, 2023 from the operation's owner, Brandel Brown, to the licensing representative, Jassica Brunson, to inquire about corrections needed for citations that were issued. Mr. Brown stated he was made aware of the corrections needed today but not about the citations being issued. The licensing rep was not made aware of citations being issued as well; therefore, an extension will be granted until Wednesday, Feb 15, 2023.

2/15/23 The remedy for this deficiency contine documentation of serious incident reports update / electronic incident report which includes all requirements. Staff has been notified and will no longer document any serious incident reports on the document without all required information and will be checked by Director Sabrina Sinclair.

Deficiency Narrative: Three out of four child records reviewed did not contain the known allergies on the exterior of the child's file.
Correction Narrative: During inspection #3920179, face sheets were observed being printed and placed on the exterior of the child's files that were missing one to show any known allergies and/or chronic conditions.

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection, observed a window to be broken in a bedroom.  Window was taped with Plexiglas glass for temporary repairs.  Observed a part of a bedroom door frame to have been detached from the wall.
Correction Narrative: Window has been replaced and closet door frame repaired as well. Corrected

Deficiency Narrative: During my inspection, it was observed in each bathroom to not have personal towels to dry hands.  In one bathroom, there was no handwashing soap.
Correction Narrative: Hand washing soap, papertowels, and tissue were observed in both bathrooms. Corrected
